question-text: Choose the correct answer for the following statements. Do not copy the statements.

set1.question-item-text: Plant fibres are (A. sclerenchymatous B. parenchymatous C. collenchymatous D. chlorenchyma) cells.
Each (A. mRNA B. rRNA C. tRNA D. codon) carries the specific amino acid at a time at its acceptor stem.
The main photosynthetic organs are the (A. stems B. roots C. leaves D. flowers).
Mosquitoes lay their eggs in (A. soil B. water C. leaves D. blood).
Coconut milk is a rich source of (A. gibberellins B. auxins C. ethylenes D. cytokinins).
The most trafficked animal in the world is the (A. rhinocerose B. pangolin C. tiger D. elephant).
The (A. erythrocytes B. leucocytes C. lymphocytes D. platelets) transport oxygen from the lungs to all the cells.
Signs of plant disease are (A. chemical B. physical C. botanical D. biochemical) evidence of the pathogen.
The endocrine glands and their hormones make up the (A. nervous system B. circulatory system C. excretory system D. endocrine system).
Climate change is a growing threat to (A. biodiversity B. biology C. botany D. geology).

set2.question-item-text: Structurally, plant fibres are (A. parenchymatous B. sclerenchymatous C. collenchymatous D. aerenchymatous) cells and are parts of the plant skeleton.
(A. Hydrogen B. Covalent C. Ionic D. Polar) bonds link each complementary base pair in the structure of DNA.
In hot conditions, (A. respiration B. photosynthesis C. transpiration D. translocation) plays an important role in cooling the leaves.
An example of infectious diseases is (A. cardiovasular disease B. cancer C. chronic respiratory disease and D. malaria).
(A. Light B. Water C. Temperature D. Gravity) causes a variety of responses in the plant body in addition to photosynthesis.
The common name of Linpai is (A. Asian Elephant B. Eldâ€™s Deer C. Irrawaddy Dolphin D. Green Peafowl).
(A. Lymph vessels B. Arteries C.Veins D. Capillaries) carry blood away from the heart towards the cells of the body.
(A. Fungi B. Bacteria C. Nematodes D. Viruses) are intracellular pathogenic particles that infect other living organisms.
The pons is located above and in front of the (A. medulla oblongata B. cerebellum C. hyphthalamus D. midbrain) in the brainstem.
(A. Aquarium B. Botanical C. Aviary D. Zoological) gardens are ideal places to integrate the study and conservation of trees species that are endangered in the wild.

set3.question-item-text: Among the ASEAN countries, Myanmar is the leading (A. pulse B. rice C. wheat D. maize) and bean producer.
DNA is a double helix structure consisting of (A. two B. three C. four D. many) polynucleotide strands.
In plant,, the dissolved mineral ions are transported in the (A. phloem B. xylem C. parenchyma D. cambium) tissue.
Smoking also changes the balance of (A. lipoproteins B. cholesterol C. atherosclerosis D. hypertension) int the blood.
The process of development occurs in an ordered fashion within a single diploid cell called (A. embryo B. zygote C. meristem D. gamete)
A marine park is a permanent marine (A. reservation B. isolation C. sanctuary D. biosphere) for the conservation of species.
The human heart is a muscular pump with (A. two B. three C. four D. five) chambers.
Most plant diseases, around 85 percent are caused by (A. nematodes B. virus C. fungal D. mosaics) organisms.
The parasympathetic system uses the neurotransmitter (A. norepinephrine B. endorphins C. dopamine D. acetylcholine) to control organ responses.
Habitat loss is the most significant cause of (A. agrobiodiversity B. biodiversity C. water D. forests) loss globally.

set4.question-item-text: Natural selection is defined as the (A. environmental B. chemical C. functional D. evolutionary) process.
The orange pigment beta-carotene which can be converted into (A. vitamin A B. vitamin B C. vitamin C D. vitamin D).
Transcription occurs in the (A. cytoplasm B. nucleus C. ribosome D. chloroplast) of the cell.
Most transpiration takes place through the (A. xylem B. phloem C. air spaces D. stomata).
The very smallest branches of the arterial system are (A. arterioles B. aorta C. coronary D. paralysis).
The myocardial infarction commonly known as a (A. stroke B. heart attack C. atheroma D. paralysis).
The only gaseous phytohormone is (A. ethylene B. gibberellin C. cytokinin D. abscisic acid).
The largest part of the brain is (A. cerebellum B. thalamus C. cerebrum D.hypothalamus).
The Red Data Book includes the list of endangered species of (A. plants B. animals C. plants and animals fossils D. plants and animals).
Wildlife trade can involve the trade of (A. living B. fossil C. living of dead D. dead) individuals
